titleStmt.title: A true account of the heroick actions and enterprises of the confederate princes against the Turks and Hungarian rebels, during the last glorious campaign but more particularly the siege and taking of Newheusel. Together with the defeat of the Turkish army near Gran. To which is added the flight and seizure of the grand rebel, Count Teckely, by the Turks; and the manner of his treatment. Licensed Novemb. 19. 1685. Ro. L'Estrange.
titleStmt.author: J. S. (John Shirley), fl. 1680-1702.

titleStmt.title: A true account of the heroick actions and enterprises of the confederate princes against the Turks and Hungarian rebels, during the last glorious campaign but more particularly the siege and taking of Newheusel. Together with the defeat of the Turkish army near Gran. To which is added the flight and seizure of the grand rebel, Count Teckely, by the Turks; and the manner of his treatment. Licensed Novemb. 19. 1685. Ro. L'Estrange.
titleStmt.author: J. S. (John Shirley), fl. 1680-1702.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for William Thackery in Duck-lane, Thomas Passinger on London-Bridge, and Tho. Sawbridge in Little-Britain,

notesStmt.note: "Preface to the reader" signed: John Shirley.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library, Oxford.
